info.title: Tác giả: Lưu Minh Khôi (Nam)
info.poem: A senior at Nguyen Sieu High School, was born and raised in Vietnam, where the land, people, and traditions became the wellspring of his inspiration. Guided by principles of the 19th-century Impressionist movement, Khoi's paintings depict the authentic light, memory, and spirit of his homeland, as he seeks to capture not only what the eyes see but what the heart feels.
info.description: This collection traces Khoi's artistic journey from 2023 to 2025. While his techniques have steadily matured over time, the sincerity and reverence at the heart of his works remain unchanged. It is this vision, woven into each brush stroke, that translates the warm and rich living palette of Vietnam into a timeless beauty on the canvas.

info.title: Lily
info.description: My journey into Impressionist painting began with the lilies that had always stood in the stillness of home, white as morning clouds. With care in her hands, my mother would place each stem, arranging both beauty and memory. At first, I thought I was only capturing the flowers’ form. But somewhere between the first sketch and the last dab of color, there appeared the light falling gently on the vase, the drifting fragrance of childhood, the quiet love that lives in the heart of our everyday life.
info.description_en: My journey into Impressionist painting began with the lilies that had always stood in the stillness of home, white as morning clouds. With care in her hands, my mother would place each stem, arranging both beauty and memory. At first, I thought I was only capturing the flowers’ form. But somewhere between the first sketch and the last dab of color, there appeared the light falling gently on the vase, the drifting fragrance of childhood, the quiet love that lives in the heart of our everyday life.

info.title: Garden cosmos
info.description: Long before lifting my brush, I sat silently noticing what’s hidden in plain sight. Water bent the stems. Light curved along the glass. Shadows pooled softly at the base. Who knew a vase would be harder to do justice to than the flowers it held.
info.description_en: Long before lifting my brush, I sat silently noticing what’s hidden in plain sight. Water bent the stems. Light curved along the glass. Shadows pooled softly at the base. Who knew a vase would be harder to do justice to than the flowers it held.

info.title: Sublime in tranquility
info.description: I visited Ba Vi for the first time in sixth grade and took a quick photo of this waterfall. Years later, I rediscovered the image and the awe that came with it. Painting this piece felt like standing amid nature again, hearing the water rush and the trees breathe.
info.description_en: I visited Ba Vi for the first time in sixth grade and took a quick photo of this waterfall. Years later, I rediscovered the image and the awe that came with it. Painting this piece felt like standing amid nature again, hearing the water rush and the trees breathe.

info.title: White Cliffs of Dover
info.description: My take on the White Cliffs of Dover. The shadows could have been more defined and the flowerbeds more evenly spread; still, the excitement was palpable when I glimpsed at a faraway land I had never set foot in.
info.description_en: My take on the White Cliffs of Dover. The shadows could have been more defined and the flowerbeds more evenly spread; still, the excitement was palpable when I glimpsed at a faraway land I had never set foot in.

info.title: Hanoi's Old Quarter
info.description: With time, the Old Quarter only makes the heart grow fonder. I was drawn to the rhythm of life tucked away in a balcony beneath lush green canopies, a rustic charm that endures no matter how the seasons change in this city.

info.title: Hydrangea
info.description: Purple speaks of sweet romance. In Da Lat, I found myself captivated by the hydrangea’s tender beauty, a fragment of which I now keep with me, forever alive on the canvas.
info.description_en: Purple speaks of sweet romance. In Da Lat, I found myself captivated by the hydrangea’s tender beauty, a fragment of which I now keep with me, forever alive on the canvas.

info.title: Sunflower
info.description: The sunflower leans to one side, a petal chipped, a stem curved. Yet despite its precarious stance, a gentle grace holds. Beauty does not live in perfection, but the subtle imbalances that make each moment complete.
info.description_en: The sunflower leans to one side, a petal chipped, a stem curved. Yet despite its precarious stance, a gentle grace holds. Beauty does not live in perfection, but the subtle imbalances that make each moment complete.

info.title: By the window
info.poem:
Anh đi em ở lại nhà
Hai vai gánh vác mẹ già, con thơ
Lầm than bao quản muối dưa
Anh đi anh liệu chen đua với đời
info.poem_en:
You go, while I stay home,
Bearing the burden of our elderly mother and young child alone.
I’ll endure hardship, no matter how tough it may be,
As you go, be sure to strive and compete with life earnestly.
info.description: A serendipitous pairing of a European-style window and Vietnamese marigolds, this piece weaves together two cultures half a world apart in enchanting unison.
info.description_en: A serendipitous pairing of a European-style window and Vietnamese marigolds, this piece weaves together two cultures half a world apart in enchanting unison.

info.title: Village reverie
info.description: My first tribute to Vietnam's highland communities, this piece was inspired by Sa Pa, a place where mountains rose like quiet guardians and colors brightened every corner. It was here that I met people whose days unfolded in harmony with the land, their laughter carried on crisp mountain air. The vibrant fabrics, the warm smiles, the grandeur of the northern landscape became the palette for my imagination
info.description_en: My first tribute to Vietnam's highland communities, this piece was inspired by Sa Pa, a place where mountains rose like quiet guardians and colors brightened every corner. It was here that I met people whose days unfolded in harmony with the land, their laughter carried on crisp mountain air. The vibrant fabrics, the warm smiles, the grandeur of the northern landscape became the palette for my imagination

info.title: Whispers of autumn
info.description:
Amid the golden blaze, a H’Mong woman walks on fire-tinted leaves, her figure swaying with the weight of the wood on her back. Sunlight spills through the branches like liquid gold, leaving copper leaves to shimmer in the eye of the beholder.
So small, yet so brave.
info.description_en:
Amid the golden blaze, a H’Mong woman walks on fire-tinted leaves, her figure swaying with the weight of the wood on her back. Sunlight spills through the branches like liquid gold, leaving copper leaves to shimmer in the eye of the beholder.
So small, yet so brave.

info.title: Verdant steps
info.description: I chose to depict the terraced fields in Ha Giang in a realist fashion, a living, breathing vision of the moment seedlings are sown. Mist drifts over the ridges, silence gathers in the folds of the earth, and a lone figure steps lightly across the red soil—a fragile line that seems to tether the vast sky to the waiting land.
info.description_en: I chose to depict the terraced fields in Ha Giang in a realist fashion, a living, breathing vision of the moment seedlings are sown. Mist drifts over the ridges, silence gathers in the folds of the earth, and a lone figure steps lightly across the red soil—a fragile line that seems to tether the vast sky to the waiting land.

info.title: Trace
info.description: The painting draws from a photograph I captured on the road to Lao Cai—a scene steeped in solitude, where silence lingers beyond words.
info.description_en: The painting draws from a photograph I captured on the road to Lao Cai—a scene steeped in solitude, where silence lingers beyond words.

info.title: Spring beyond the Gate
info.description:
Spring drifts into the village on a chilly breeze, bringing plum blossoms on the branches like scattered light. Someone is coming, carrying the weight of daily life, yet each step softened by the season’s gentle renewal.
The beginning of the year was portrayed on canvas as I saw it in real life: fresh, ardent, and filled with hope.
info.description_en:
Spring drifts into the village on a chilly breeze, bringing plum blossoms on the branches like scattered light. Someone is coming, carrying the weight of daily life, yet each step softened by the season’s gentle renewal.
The beginning of the year was portrayed on canvas as I saw it in real life: fresh, ardent, and filled with hope.

info.title: Ascent in Amber
info.description: As the afternoon sun lingers, its golden light washes over the earthen walls, casting long, tender shadows. A woman ascends the stone steps, her back bent slightly beneath a bundle of firewood, each movement steady and unhurried. I have always held a deep admiration for the mountain people here, who toil tirelessly regardless of the weather. With my brush, I hope to express my humble respect and reverence for their unwavering dedication.

info.title: Silent Anchorage
info.description: A fishing boat rests quietly, tethered to a single post after a long day at sea. Beneath the weight of dusk, its worn frame carries the memory of labor, the rhythm of tides, and the trust of those who sailed with it. The sky burns with orange light yet holds the hush of approaching storm clouds, casting a stillness that feels both fragile and eternal. For me, completing this piece was a meditation on vision and patience. Though more last-minute changes were made than I would have liked, it was in the acceptance of imperfections that art found its truest form.
info.description_en: A fishing boat rests quietly, tethered to a single post after a long day at sea. Beneath the weight of dusk, its worn frame carries the memory of labor, the rhythm of tides, and the trust of those who sailed with it. The sky burns with orange light yet holds the hush of approaching storm clouds, casting a stillness that feels both fragile and eternal. For me, completing this piece was a meditation on vision and patience. Though more last-minute changes were made than I would have liked, it was in the acceptance of imperfections that art found its truest form.

info.title: Nhà
info.description: Straw leans by the path, next to walls that wear the faded colors of time. A lone figure steps through the gate, carrying the weight of an ordinary day. Nothing calls for attention, yet everything belongs—simple, steady, and whole.
info.description_en: Straw leans by the path, next to walls that wear the faded colors of time. A lone figure steps through the gate, carrying the weight of an ordinary day. Nothing calls for attention, yet everything belongs—simple, steady, and whole.

info.title: Hoa
info.description: Earth and gold. The rapeseed flowers grown by the H’Mong people in Ha Giang already made for a striking centerpiece, but I also wanted to use a textured vase, a creation of the local ethnic people, to preserve the cultural soul of this painting.
info.description_en: Earth and gold. The rapeseed flowers grown by the H’Mong people in Ha Giang already made for a striking centerpiece, but I also wanted to use a textured vase, a creation of the local ethnic people, to preserve the cultural soul of this painting.

info.title: Thuyền 2
info.poem:
Ai xui má đỏ , môi hồng
Để anh nhác thấy đem lòng thương yêu
info.description: This painting is a tribute to the tireless fishermen of Vietnam. The boat, the faithful companion through countless tides, rests quietly beside the weathered pier, a silent witness to generations of fish, shrimp, and squids that have nourished the village. The late afternoon sun drapes the scene in a warm, golden glow, as the harbor breathes with the rhythm of labor and the resilience of life at sea. In this still moment, I seek to reveal not only the serene beauty of sunset, but the enduring spirit and character of those who call the waves their home.
info.description_en: This painting is a tribute to the tireless fishermen of Vietnam. The boat, the faithful companion through countless tides, rests quietly beside the weathered pier, a silent witness to generations of fish, shrimp, and squids that have nourished the village. The late afternoon sun drapes the scene in a warm, golden glow, as the harbor breathes with the rhythm of labor and the resilience of life at sea. In this still moment, I seek to reveal not only the serene beauty of sunset, but the enduring spirit and character of those who call the waves their home.

info.title: Sự bình thản
info.description: Bức tranh mô tả hình ảnh người phụ nữ trước giàn hỏa thiêu. Cô ây đối mặt với cái chết bằng một nét mặt bình thản và không chút sợ hãi. Bản lĩnh và thần thái không dao động của người phụ nữ được tác giả miêu tả bằng những gam màu tối, đơn giản đầy ấn tượng
info.description_en:
Inspired by a Grimm fairy tale: 'The Twelve Brothers'.
Growing up, I was a big fan of the Grimm Brothers’ Fairy Tales: quirky, yet full of humanity. With each tale, there is a lesson that is both meaningful and entertaining.
In this piece, I drew the princess standing calmly amidst fire, on the verge of being executed. Despite the perilous situation, she remained silent out of loyalty to her brothers and adherence to her promise. Her unwavering bravery and trust, therefore, brought her a well-deserved ending.
am impressed with the strong, principled woman figure depicted in this story, and as such, this painting was born—the woman amidst the fire and flames.

info.title: Giấu mặt
info.description: Phụ nữ và Hoa như hai là một, như một mà là hai là bởi họ luôn đẹp như loài hoa và mỏng manh yếu đuối như những cánh hoa. Cả thế giới này tôn thờ vẻ đẹp đó nên cho dù họ là ai, họ ở đâu, họ là tầng lớp nào. Họ kiêu sa hay trần trụi thì vẫn là những bông hoa đẹp nhất. Bức tranh thể hiện nét đẹp của một người phụ nữ giấu mặt để nói lên điều đó.
info.description_en: With orange hues instead of conventional red, the painting depicts a woman holding a bouquet of flaming flowers close to her heart—just like an unrequited love that burns her chest, but is no less beautiful.

info.title: Cô gái IRAN
info.description: Phong Tục của người  Hồi giáo thường bắt phụ nữ ra ngoài phải trùm đầu che đi mái tóc chính vì thế người phụ nữ rất thiệt thòi khi không được phô diễn vẻ đẹp chân thực của mình. Bức vẽ này tôi muốn lột tả vẻ đẹp đó . Người phụ nữ qua  Ánh mắt  đã thể hiện sự quyết liệt phá bỏ mọi giới hạn của nữ quyền truyền thống để hướng đến tương lai
info.description_en:
Islamic women traditionally wear hijabs as a symbol of modesty and faith, and those not complying are considered shameless.
There are some who are not satisfied with this imposition on women. Despite this unfairness, they remain undeterred; their intense, unwavering gaze reflects a strong determination to fight for their rights and seek justice.

info.title: Tỏa sáng
info.description_en: A trowel painting I made out of pure whim.With red as the dominant color and a scratchy texture, the painting gives off an intense and powerful vibe.
info.description:
Bức vẽ nhỏ được thể hiện trong phút giây đầy ngẫu hứng. Giống như những người phụ nữ nếu biết làm cho mình trở nên đẹp hơn thì cho dù trong hoàn cảnh nào cũng đều có thể trở nên rực rỡ nhất như những bông hoa có thể mọc ở bất kỳ nơi đâu.
Cả một gam màu đỏ tưởng chừng đơn điệu nhưng vẫn rất dễ để nhận ra có bông hoa màu trắng đang tỏa sáng rực rỡ, nổi bật giữa sự lộn xộn.

info.title: Trăng rằm
info.description:
Vẫn lại là một cô gái mới lớn còn e lệ nhưng vẫn muốn khoe cái vẻ đẹp như trăng rằm của mình.
Tấm lưng trần là trung tâm bố cục bức vẽ nhằm lột tả điều này. Xung quanh là đàn ong bướm rập rìu như muôn vàn các chàng trai đang muốn tiếp cận cô gái ấy. Cô gái dùng hai bàn tay ôm lấy cơ thể mình như là một sự tự bảo vệ mình trước sự cám dỗ.
info.description_en: The painting depicts a young girl whose womanhood just began to bloom. She is yet too shy to reveal her beauty to all, yet said beauty is already radiant like a full moon even when hidden. Surrounding her are bees and butterflies, symbolic of how even nature is drawn to her, enchanted by her charm. Wrapping her arms around herself signals her vulnerability and effort to protect her innocence against the temptations of the world.

info.title: Cô gái hiện đại
info.description:
Chân dung một cô gái hiện đại được thể hiện trên bình gốm nhằm truyền tải thông điệp về sự phá cách, đề cao cá tính mỗi cá nhân trong xã hội hiện đại ngày nay.
Cô gái với gu trang điểm lạ mắt ấn tượng như muốn thể hiện với thế giới về một cái Tôi đầy cá tính riêng của mình
info.description_en: With an abstract art style, the vase has a darker feel, featuring green and blue as the primary colors.

info.title: Môi đỏ – Má hồng
info.description:
Tác phẩm thể hiện gương mặt một cô gái hiện đại với phong cách trang điểm mạnh có đôi mắt cụp xuống như đang nhìn lại về thế giới nội tâm của mình thể hiện con người hướng nội nhưng vẫn đầy quyến rũ và cá tính.
Thông điệp của tác phẩm là: Mỗi cô gái dù là hướng nội hay hướng ngoại đều là những bông hoa trong vườn hoa nhiều màu sắc của thế giới này
info.description_en: Using a vibrant color palette, the drawing on the vase exudes a cheerful summer vibe.

info.title: Tình quê
info.poem:
Cây đa lá rụng đầu đình
Bao nhiêu lá rụng thương mình bấy nhiêu
info.poem_en:
The banyan tree sheds its leaves at the village gate,
As many leaves fall, so does my love for you.
info.description: Có ai mà đếm được lá rụng? Câu ví con ấy như câu hỏi từ đáy lòng của người con gái thương người mình yêu. Cây Đa cổ thụ như là biểu trưng cho mối tình son sắt của người phụ nữ.
info.description_en:
A banyan tree that grew near my grandmother’s home village.
Resting near a small pond, the banyan tree is somewhat reminiscent of a young maiden admiring her own reflection on the water.

info.title: Đồng dao tuổi thơ
info.description: Là những hình ảnh về những trò chơi tuổi thơ, những câu Đồng Dao trong những câu chuyện Mẹ kể tôi nghe luôn hiện hữu trong những giấc mơ của tôi.
info.description_en: Inspired partly by the Cubism art movement

info.title: Cánh cò tuổi thơ
info.poem:
Con cò mà đi ăn đêm
Đậu phải cành mềm, lộn cổ xuống ao
Ông ơi ông vớt tôi nao
Tối có lòng nào ông hãy xáo măng
Có xáo thì xáo nước trong
Đừng xáo nước đục đau lòng cò con!
info.poem_en:
The stork goes out to search for food at night,
Lands on a fragile branch, tumbles into the pond in fright.
Oh sir, please help me, I dread,
If you take my life, boil me with bamboo shoots instead.
When you do, let it be in clear water,
Not in murky waters—it would sadden my young ones farther.
info.description: Con cò đi đón cơn mưa Tối tăm mù mịt ai đưa cò về Những lời ru của Mẹ trong tuổi thơ tôi là những hình ảnh về con cò gầy guộc, lặn lội bờ ao đi ăn đêm. Thân cò gậy guộc là hình ảnh những người phụ nữ trong xã hội xưa đầy mong manh yếu ớt. Cò đang bay lên mà như bị sức nặng phải sà chân xuống. Bên dưới đó chỉ là những cây cỏ yếu ớt và mặt nước bao la khiến nó dường như không còn chỗ bấu víu . Bức tranh thể hiện sự cô đơn, yếu thế của người phụ nữ trong quá khứ.
info.description_en: As a kid, I would fall asleep to this classic folk song, sung by my father. And, of course, every kid would grow up and see the tragic fate that befell the stork. It is almost an irony, how a serene lullaby that carries us all to sleep carries such a somber meaning.

info.title: Bốn Mùa
info.poem:
Cánh cò cõng nắng cõng mưa,
Mẹ tôi cõng cả bốn mùa gió sương
info.poem_en:
The heron carries the sun and the rain,
My mother carries the four seasons of wind and dew.
info.description: Câu ca dao trên là sự tảo tần của người Mẹ Việt Nam. Tôi đã thể hiện hình ảnh đó qua chiếc bình gốm. Một món đồ trang trí thủ công mà Mẹ tôi rất yêu thích để cắm hoa thường ngày. Cho dù là ngày Xuân mưa phùn, ngày Hạ nắng rát hay Thu se lạnh, Đông giá buốt thì Mẹ vẫn tảo tần gánh cả cuộc đời mỗi người con trên đôi vai gầy. Đó là sự chịu thương, chịu khó của người Mẹ Việt Nam, là nét đẹp muôn đời của người phụ nữ.
info.description_en: Each color represents the four seasons—Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter—to illustrate the image of a woman farmer working diligently throughout the year.

info.title: Thuyền và Biển
info.poem:
Thuyền ơi có nhớ bến chăng
Bến thì một dạ khăng khăng đợi thuyền
info.poem_en:
Boat, do you remember the dock?
The dock waits unwaveringly for the boat.
info.description: Con thuyền lênh đênh giữa trời nước bao la mà không hề biết rằng luôn có bến bờ ngày ngày mong chờ nó. Câu ca dao trên như lời tự sự từ đáy lòng của những người phụ nữ mòn mỏi chờ chồng.
info.description_en: The boat and the port - a popular metaphor for husband and wife. In this painting, I wanted to depict a lone ‘boat’ missing the solace of home—the port, or the waiting woman.

info.title: Cơn mưa đi ngang
info.description:
Đơn giản là 1 hình ảnh đẹp tôi bắt gặp trên đường. Hình ảnh về những người mẹ, người vợ đang tần tảo mưu sinh thường ngày.
Trời mưa to, khung cảnh một màu xám xịt u tối hiện ra trước mắt nhưng người phụ nữ ấy vẫn mạnh mẽ giữa mưa giông. Sắc áo mưa màu hồng đan xen lẫn màu sắc của gánh hoa là tượng trưng cho niềm tin về một tương lai tươi sáng trong cuộc đời người mẹ, người vợ ấy.
info.description_en: A beautiful image I captured on the street.Against the gloomy gray background, a woman’s pink raincoat and the colorful flowers she sells stands out strikingly.
